text: Hi all, I'm a potential GSOC student working on making <https://github.com/TuringLang/AdvancedHMC.jl|AdvancedHMC.jl> (one of the main inference algorithms used by Turing) GPU-compatible. I have a question about running CI for GPUs with buildkite. Do I understand the README at <https://github.com/JuliaGPU/buildkite> correctly, that Julia packages which can work on the GPU can use JuliaGPU infrastructure to run CI tests for their GPU code? If that's true, what are the criteria for getting access to that infrastructure? CC: <@U6H9SJKCH> <@UHDNY2YMA>

elements.text: Hi all, I'm a potential GSOC student working on making
(one of the main inference algorithms used by Turing) GPU-compatible. I have a question about running CI for GPUs with buildkite. Do I understand the README at

correctly, that Julia packages which can work on the GPU can use JuliaGPU infrastructure to run CI tests for their GPU code? If that's true, what are the criteria for getting access to that infrastructure? CC:

text: none really, as long as it's a publicly available Julia package using GPUs, preferably part of an organization (those are easier to register with BuildKite)

elements.text: none really, as long as it's a publicly available Julia package using GPUs, preferably part of an organization (those are easier to register with BuildKite)

text: thanks for the quick reply! so just to make sure that I understand correctly: it's as simple as setting up buildkite for the organization (here Turing) and then simply follow the steps in the README?

elements.text: thanks for the quick reply! so just to make sure that I understand correctly: it's as simple as setting up buildkite for the organization (here Turing) and then simply follow the steps in the README?

text: no, the TuringLang org will need to be added to the JuliaLang buildkite. that however requires somebody with admin access to the GitHub org to install the BK plugin, and IIRC that was problematic for the Turing org?

elements.text: no, the TuringLang org will need to be added to the JuliaLang buildkite. that however requires somebody with admin access to the GitHub org to install the BK plugin, and IIRC that was problematic for the Turing org?
